results.description:
ALL LEVELS ARE WELCOME

(If you are a beginner and wish to join the party, please come for a brief rating session before joining the party.  This is a social tennis group, rather than an instructional session.)

Also check out my website:  www.tennis-buffs.com

If you sign up via Meet Up site, you must call me to find out your start time. I would like to stagger players. You may or may not be able to start at 8pm, as it depends on how many spots there are left. Thank you for your understanding.

Saturdays, starts 8pm

Cost $40

Includes tennis, balls and food

9 Indoor air-conditioned hard courts

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends! Binghamton Racquet Club is centrally located for tennis players in the Tri-State area, only 5 minutes from the GWB, a good location for players from Rockland County, NYC, Westchester, Hoboken, Jersey City and other areas in NJ.

It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends!

Penny Jung
Event Coordinator
www.tennis-buffs.com

results.description:
Your Holidays were a bust! Your broke from Christmas, hungover from New Years, and you already broke your resolutions! Why sit around and feel down, when you can come share some laughs for FREE!

Back by popular demand the "Let Me Speak To Your Manager" show is bringing you the best up and coming comics in NYC, all of whom have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc..!

It all goes down at Stone Creek Bar and Grill in the back room. Come down, enjoy some of the drinks from the fully stocked bar or some food off the awesome menu!

Seating in the backroom starts at 9 and the show starts shortly after.
Come early and hang out in the front room of the bar!

The show is free and has a 1 item minimum. Come out and celebrate the weekends with some laughs!
results.name: Let Me Speak To Your Manager- Free Comedy Show w. Pre-show Hangout

BOLLYWOOD BEATS

L E X I C O N 
226 East 54th Street. NYC 

Special Guest : Featuring Delhi's Finest DJ AMIT

Dhol Percussions By : RAVI BINDRA 

SPONSORED VIP OPEN BAR 9:30-10:30PM

Desi Saturdays is one high society DesiParty. Wow factor everywhere. Beautiful people, beautiful venue, beautiful ambiance, and did we mention beautiful people? High energy, amazing music and a packed house are just some of the traits of what you would expect at this weekly desiparty. 

This event is the talk of the town amongst young socialites. It's so exclusive it only takes place on Saturday Nights, and don't even try to dress down, because it is almost impossible to get in, but more importantly you would feel so out of place. So don your best, and you may just be lucky enough to party out on Saturdays Nights at Lexicon!!

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

group.name: NYC PICKUP SOCCER (MANHATTAN CO-ED SOCCER GROUP)

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8. 2 subs per team. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

Bring a white and black t-shirt, and good attitude.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

results.description:
RSVP required


What equipment is required?

A mask, snorkel, fins and a weight belt suitable for SCUBA* and dive boots. A wetsuit is optional and recommended. We have special pricing for our students. Let us know when you would like to come in to be fitted for your student equipment package. Most important is that you will get the "Right Gear, the Right Fit at the Right Price" *Note: Snorkeling equipment is not always suitable for SCUBA activities.

Please arrive on time, late arrivals are subject to rescheduling and fees.

If you have any questions please email or call the shop

New Students, If this is your first pool session, you must:
1. Complete the required academics before the pool session;

Online Students must complete Chapters 1 -6CD Rom students must complete Sections 1-5

2. Bring a bathing suit and a towel. There are lockers in the changing room so bring a lock if you like.

3. Drink plenty of water before class

4. Don't forget to print out and bring your skills checklist.

5. Print out a copy of the Hand Signals to review and bring with you.

6. If you have not yet completed a "Student Folder" at the store. 
</a>Please print out, complete and bring the following three forms to the pool;

<a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/sdi_forms_03_general_liability_release.pdf">SDI General Liability Waiver Fill in ALL the blanks the  "Instructors": F. Ventura & C.K. Scharf, the "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA",  the  Agency is" SDI" and Others": (fill in at pool), then, Sign and date at bottom

SDI Medical Info Waiver "Instructor": F. Ventura,  "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA ,"City of" Paramus "state of" N.J.

Student Information Form</a>

If you have answered YES to any of the medical question; Please print out and have your MD complete the following <a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/SDI_Physician_Sign_Off_2013.pdf">Physician Sign-Off Form

Why it's a good idea for Divers to own their own SCUBA gear?

RSVP Now

Please RSVP for all pool sessions. RSVPs are required so that we have sufficient staffing for each session. Students who do not RSVP may not get on the roster.No shows are subject to a $29 rescheduling fee.

results.description:
Excellent games last week. Thanks to everyone for joining us and coming early. Now that the holidays are over and it's starting to feel like winter we expect the numbers to decrease. That means it's important that those that RSVP actually show up and arrive on time. Attendance are viewed more closely around winter and summer so please don't make me call you out.

We're playing at our normal home address, namely the soccer field at Dyker for the foreseeable future. The artificial field should have good traction if it's wet and is easier to run in during snow and ice. All you need is a pair of cleats, gloves, and a change of socks if it's wet or snowing.

Come join us for some fun but please SHOW UP ON TIME!! If you show up after we started a game then you will sit out the whole first game.

***************

 
Attendance will be strictly enforced. No-shows will be marked and posted on the subsequent meetup. First time offenders will be given the benefit of doubt, second time offenders will be warned (consider your name in this email and the number of times you no-showed as warning) and those who miss a third time will be banned,permanently! Those that show up without RSVP to circumvent this will be warned as well. We need to know how many people will show up in order to decide if we have enough people for a game that week.

All new members are allowed to play for free the first three games. If you decide to continue with us then please remit the membership fee. Our season starts on 9/1 and the $10 is good for all games for the year

results.description:
Hello Everybody,,,, Hope you all had a wonderful Christmas and a Fabulous New Years celebration !    


This Sunday, January 3rd, I would like you all to join me for a walk down the Henry Hudson Trail,,,, We haven't done this one in a while. And I know how much you all love it. This is really a fantastic  walk for all you New Peeps to join us on. You'll make new friends, get some exercise, and have a wonderful time to boot ! 


• At 8:45am We will Meet in the Big Commuter Parking Lot on The Left that you pass on the way to Sissy's...


This is always a fun walk for all the Newbies to come out and get acquainted with everyone.  This walk has some spectacular views.

Believe it or not there is a little Park off to the side of the trail. Some even call it the "Secret Garden". We can take a quick peek at it if you wish... It only takes a couple of minutes to do it.

We will be walking in an Easterly Direction till we hit the end of the trail at Highlands. Then we'll take a break for a few minutes.... maybe talk about the Great Breakfast we all want to have.  Then we will head on back to our starting point. From there, for those who want to join us for coffee & a bite to eat. We'll probably go into town to the Town & Surf Diner, Which BTW is Very Good, and takes good care of us.

Sneakers may be worn, but You might want to wear Hiking Boots/Shoes for walking on this trail,,,

And.....As always, we will walk in a LIGHT RAIN and Sunshine

Please Remember to Dress for the Weather ! 

• Please Only bring Two-Legged Friends. ! Thank you for understanding. 

• See you all @ 9:00am. And please arrive 10 minutes early so we get started at 9am !

Only A Heavy Rain will Cancel this walk and it will be posted on this page. Those who signed on will be notified By E-mail. If in doubt, check it out. 

CANCELLATIONS Rarely Ever Happen !

results.description:
Flag Football Game at Cunningham Park (196th St and Union Turnpike) in Queens. Come out and join us!

We have cones and flags so all you need is cleats if that is what you prefer. GAMES WILL ALWAYS BE PLAYED REGARDLESS OF THE WEATHER CONDITIONS i.e. rain, snow, cold, mud, ice, storm, hurricane, etc...we never cancel games due to weather...games are fun and competitive, all skill levels are welcome, please contact me if you have any questions.

NOTE: PLEASE RSVP "YES" ONLY IF YOU ARE GOING TO SHOW UP TO THE GAME.  YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF SOMETHING COMES UP (OR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY IF IT'S TOO COLD/IT'S RAINING/IT'S SNOWING) AND YOU CAN'T MAKE IT.  NO-SHOWS WILL BE REMOVE FROM THE GROUP.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ACCURATE HEAD COUNT SO WE KNOW HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE REALLY COMING.

ere are some of the new changes we have made and a reminder of some of the guidelines we already have:

1) You can not add  guests to your RSVP.  Anyone is free to come and play IF AND ONLY IF you have a profile in meetup and have joined our group.  It's 100% FREE to join and it only takes about 2 minutes to sign up and RSVP.  There are also FREE mobile apps for iPhones and Android phones so you can RSVP easily on the go.  If any of your friends has been playing and wants to continue to play, ask them to go to http://www.meetup.com/Cunningham-Park-Football/ and sign up and RSVP individually.  YOU CAN NOT PLAY if you're not signed up and RSVPd.

2) The first 20 people that RSVP for the game, will play a 9-on-9 game with 1 sub.  Everyone on the waiting list will pick players and play against the winner of the game.  Games will be to 2 scores.  If a team gets 2 scores, with the score 2-1, the other team gets one (1) more possession to try to score and tie the game.  If the game is tied again, the game is now to 3 points and the same rule applies, once one of the teams gets score #3, the other team gets just one (1) more possession to try to tie the game.  If 20 or less players show up to the game, game can be played to whatever score everyone agrees to.

3) If you're one of the first 20 to RSVP, but you're late, the next person on the waiting list that's present on the field will take your place and play in the first game.

4) On a safety, ball stays at the goal line and the next down will be played.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and a safety occurs, the ball stays at the goal line and the 3rd down will be played.

5) On an OBVIOUS "Defensive Pass interference", the ball will stay at the line of scrimmage but you reset your plays and start at 1st down again.  For example: If a 3rd down play is ran and a DPI occurs, the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and a 1st down will be played, then 2nd, then 3rd...etc.

6) On an OBVIOUS "Offensive Pass interference", the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and the offensive time will lose a down.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and an OPI occurs, the offensive team will now be on a 4th down situation from the line of scrimmage.

7) As you might have noticed we have had very few injuries (knock on wood) throughout the years.  This is why we wanted to remind you of the following:

-Stiff arming, flag guarding and hand slapping are NOT ALLOWED.

-Blocks from the back are NOT allowed ad they're obviously dangerous and can cause injuries.

-VERY IMPORTANT: If you are the offensive player and have the ball in your hands, you MUST avoid contact and CAN NOT under any circumstances lower your shoulders and try to initiate contact with an defensive player.  This is flag football, if you're looking for a different type of game there are plenty of other places and leagues to play flag or full-contact football.

8) Donations:  I pay the monthly fee for hosting these meetups and never charge anyone.  All we asked for you is to drop at least $1 in the container we have set up for this, all the money is used for equipment, flags, cones, etc.  You can click on "Group Tools > Money" and see where all the money is going.  If we buy anything with that money we record the transaction and upload a picture of the receipt of whatever equipment we bought.  Next thing we want to get are end zone weighted pylons and we want to buy orange rope so we can mark the field faster and more accurately to avoid any arguments about where the first down is or what not.

IMPORTANT: WE ARE ALL ADULTS AND OBVIOUSLY CAN'T FORCE ANYONE TO DO ANYTHING.  WE NEED EVERYONE'S COOPERATION TO FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE GUIDELINES TO KEEP THE GAME FUN AND COMPETITIVE.  IF FOR ANY REASON YOU DISAGREE OR BELIEVE THAT THESE GUIDELINES DO NOT FIT YOUR STYLE OF PLAY OR WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR ON A PICK-UP GAME, YOU'RE WELCOME TO PLAY WITH A DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUP OR IN ANY OTHER PICK-UP GAME...NO HARD FEELINGS.

If you have any suggestions, questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me at[masked] or [masked]

Regards,

Carlos

results.description:
This run starts at the "Wild Duck Pond" area of the Saddle River County Park in Ridgewood. We will start at the beginning of the mile markers which is near the exit, not near the entrance. There's parking close to the beginning of the path. If you cannot park in the lot nearest the beginning of the path, you'll need to reenter the park and park in the next closest lot. The driving area of the park is U-shaped so to get to the parking lot closest to the start of the run, you essentially drive around the "U" and approach the exit to the last lot on the right (by the dog park).

We will start at the "Wild Duck Pond Area" and will turn around at the 2 mile marker. If you'd like to run more or less, you are certainly welcome to do so as the mile markers make it simple to track your distance. If you wish to run at a slower pace, I am more than happy to run with you at your preferred pace. Nobody gets left in the dust. This is a fun run, not a competition.

We will run rain or shine, hot or cold. If you RSVP "Yes", please do your best to be on time as we'll only wait a couple of minutes to get rolling. If you have questions, comments, or doubts, feel free to email me.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Did you forget to sing? Perhaps after Third Grade, when the peer pressure set in. Perhaps someone picked out the "Gifted and Talented" - and it wasn't you. Or maybe the Nuns made you sing "God Bless America" and someone laughed. Or you were one of the "Blue Birds" - you moved your mouth but didn't make any sound. Or did you sing beautifully in that Elementary School play? Was it the Middle School chorus, where the boys were thrown out and it ended up a Girls Club that made a sound in three parts, so beautiful nothing to this day has extinguished that feeling? Perhaps you were one of the guys who made harmony in the reverb of the Boys Room, or in the audience at the concert, or the sports stadium, or in the shower?

Or maybe you played an instrument that kept your mouth busy, and you never did get the chance to sing? Was it the race of competition for excellence in something, something else, that left you no time?

Was is the implicit warning, between the lines of the praises of privilege, that you should not express yourself? Did you forget that feeling of camaraderie and being a part of something bigger than yourself? Did you forget that amazement you felt at yourself being able to memorize a large piece and give it your all - weeks and months of practice that lead to a performance, or several, that made you feel powerful, hopeful, inspired and you had drawn upon that experience to guide your life? You had that moment, lifted by the magic of the "ordered progression though time and space," that made life so rich, so romantic, so filled with spirit.

And then did you forget?

Forget that feeling, that high, that experience of joy and sadness, playing the part, being a messenger, a vessel. You forgot that there are scientific studies praising the participation in music and art, the health benefits, the raised white blood cell count, the relaxation response, the breathing, the healing power of sound, or just the old saying, "singing is good for you."

Now you have another chance.

Don't miss it.
results.name: Did You Forget to Sing?

results.description:
A two hour timed, out & back run on the Palisades Park Long Path.

Where: South entrance of the GW bridge sidewalk on the Manhattan side.

When: 10 am

Trail Details: We'll run over the GW bridge, to the Palisades long path. Then we run for 1 hour, turn around and run back. How far is that? Depends on your pace and skill level. Total run time should be 2 hours. Perhaps a bit longer, if you are tired on the way back. Perhaps a bit less, if you conserve your energy on the way out. This a great time to build your aerobic base and keep your heart rate low. This is a mild trail, great for beginners. Keep in mind though, it does tend to get more technical the farther north you go. As always, we encourage all speeds to join, no matter how fast or slow. Can't run for two hours? No worries, simply turn around sooner and we'll see you back at Le Chéile.

Public Transit: Take the A train to 175th Street. The the south entrance of the GW bridge sidewalk is near the corner of West 178th Street and Cabrini Boulevard. (Meet at the north entrance, if the south is closed.) If you live in Jersey, meet us at the trail head on the Jersey side at 10:15-ish.

Bag Drop/Etc: Afterwards, we head to Le Chéile for drinks and food. Le Chéile is Located on the corner of W 181st Street and Cabrini Blvd 2 blocks from the south entrance of the GW bridge sidewalk.

By Car: Put 839 West 181st Street, Ny 10033 in your GPS

Bag Drop/Etc: There is always a bush or a pile of leaves to stash your stuff in, just make sure everything important is on you while you run. Sometimes BTR members who own cars show up at this location.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be wearing BTR shirts and looking like trail runners.
results.name: Sunday Trail Run!

results.description: service at North Church Queens starts at 10 am and goes till 11 am. then there is fellowship which i like to call snacks and a low key party. the gardens are beautiful to visit. the bible is read by someone in the congregation. passages are the same for many of the churches regardless of the denomination- some set calendar thing that many Christian Churches go by. we sing some songs which is fun cause our organist really rocks! then there is the sermon which are most often, very interesting. we say some prayers, get forgiven for our sins~ as we forgive others who sin against us. communion is every first sunday. it is bread and grape juice in those individual small plastic shot glass type things.
results.name: Go to Church!

group.name: Spirituality, Exercise & Peace @ North Church Queens

results.description:
Uncover the power of a quieter mind and ensure the renewal of a healthier you through movement, breath, and meditation. I welcome each student to come escape the bustle of the city to experience above and find their inner guru in my  class!

WELCOME 2016! 

As we welcome 2016, let's plant the seed and watch it grow together!  While the air is (finally) crisping and the wind is whispering coming of the snowy tides, it's a perfect opportunity to recuperate, hibernate, and seek introspection.  Come slow and quiet down with us in a weekly cozy practice to balance the Vata (movement/air) dosha and learn how you can best take care of yourself in order to blossom in the Spring...  


Since March 2013, this donation based Meet Up group has aimed to provide a light-hearted and non-competitive space.  One can expect clear instructions, demonstration, gentle hands-on assistance, and achieve greater flexibility, strength, balance, focus, and sense of ease with regular attendance.  

Extra mats and blocks are limited, kindly bring yours if you have them.


*To offset Meetup Organizer's fees, a suggested donation between $7-10 will be greatly appreciated*

Thank you and please do post any questions.  I hope to see you soon! 

Jennifer ( 500 Hour Yoga Alliance Registered  Teacher)

Soup Kitchen

There is a REAL NEED!


Meet at St.Barts kitchen (in the basement) @ 10:45am

The pasta, veggies & meat menu works very well.

Below are items that are needed for this menu.

Some are are sale (see below)

Please post what you plan to bring on our meetup page

so we can have a complete meal! (click on the link below) Needed: Last month we fed about 42, these qty's/menu work for a group that size.

•  3 pounds of meat (chop meat, sausage etc.

• Pasta Sauce (large jars) 5-10 depending on size

• Frozen veggies, (one or two very large bags)

• Salad

• Dessert

Father Daniel Berrigan, S.J. wrote: Sometime in your life, hope that you might see one starved person, the look on his face when the bread finally arrives. Hope that you might have baked it or bought or even kneaded it yourself. For that look on his face, for your meeting his eyes across a piece of bread, you might be willing to lose a lot, or suffer a lot, or even die a little.


RSVP please, so we can provide a complete meal!

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

How many times have you walked through Grand Central and actually taken time to really appreciate how beautiful it is? With this Scavenger Hunt you will not only get to appreciate one of  New York's most iconic buildings, but you will get to meet dozens of interesting NYSN members and friends in a fun and casual way. It is even more beautiful with all the holiday decorations.

Come alone or with a friend and we will team you up with others attending.  Enjoy a cocktail or cup of coffee with the group then we will send you out on your adventure.

Each team will have 75 minutes to complete the scavenger hunt with a list of questions, challenges, and puzzles.

The teams with the most points will win prizes.

Following the hunt you can stay at St. Pat's for our Sunday Brunch Party.

Cost: $10 PLEASE BRING EXACT CHANGE

Level: No prior knowledge needed of anything… just have fun.

What to wear: dress for the weather but 98% of the clues are inside Grand Central

Can I come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.  We will team you up with other fun people.
results.name: EZ Grand Central Scavenger Hunt & Party

results.description:
http://nysec.org/sites/default/files/styles/medium/public/images/anne-emily.png?itok=a-9boAMf Dr. Anne Klaeysen, Leader and Emily Newman

Monica Weiss presides 

In 1893, the Parliament of the World's Religions was created to cultivate interreligious harmony and foster direct engagement among religious leaders to achieve a just, peaceful, and sustainable world.  Ethical Culture participated then, and, at the 2015 Parliament, we joined 10,000 people from 80 nations and 50 faiths gathered in Salt Lake City. Leader Anne Klaeysen and NYSEC member Emily Newman will share images, stories and music from their experiences there and explore ways that NYSEC can support the Parliament’s vision to “reclaim the heart of our humanity.”

Entry to our 100-year-old building and meeting rooms is available for most wheelchair users with prior arrangements. Please call ahead  [masked] x 107) for setup of our portable system and plan to arrive one hour before start time.

results.description: This is our  indoor circuit Training session to prepare our team for the 16th annual indoor erg competition on March 19th 2016.  The circuit training will be conducted by our team captain Dave L. and current Dragon Boat Team USA member Greg.  The circuit training will include 4 to 6 workout stations.  1 of the stations will be a Dragon boat rowing machine. You will get a taste of what it is like to be rowing in a Dragon Boat.  Please do not get intimated, we have dragon boat members from ages 14 to 68 years old.  It is all about your personal best and  having fun working out with a group of friendly people.

results.description:
With the election of Barack Obama to the presidency in 2008, many felt that American society had turned a corner and at long last we were consigning our ugly legacy of racism to the past. Recent events, from the wholesale killing of young black men by ever-militarized police, who act with impunity, to fascist rhetoric coming from presidential aspirants in this election cycle that demonizes minorities, can cause us to despair at the enduring character in American racism. Looking beyond the headlines, I want to ask, How can we understand why racism so stubbornly persists in our society? I want to look at some thoughts and theories of distinguished African-Americans in order to broaden our thinking.

Read more here.

Everyone is welcome to attend our Sunday morning platform meetings
results.name: Dr. Joe Chuman on The Farther Reaches of America’s Racism

The study is open to all.  If you don’t have a Bible, we will have one for you.

Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on your Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually attending from all the groups participating.  If you have questions regarding this event contact the host directly at [masked] or call[masked]-2256.

80% of this tour takes place under cover or inside! Enjoy a fresh and different way to enjoy a Sunday afternoon with others. Learn tons of cool things on the tour with a few dozen members and friends from several Meet Up Groups, then enjoy an optional post tour brunch party.

Our tours are designed for fun and friendly members of NYSN and our partner social networking groups.  This is not a tour for tourists but for people who live in and around NY or who are new to the area who want to learn more about the city they live in and the amazing things they are surrounded by every day!  Celebrate the 103 year anniversary of Grand Central with this fun and informative to while socializing with members and friends from NYSN and other Social Networking Groups. Did you know that the current Grand Central building is actually the 3rd incarnation of the historic building on that site?  Learn about Secret platforms, top secret rooms and interesting facts and surprises during this adventure filled with exploring, socializing and learning.  Your tour guide will also share  photos from the late 1800’s and early 1900’s that will  amaze you and change your perspective on the building and the neighborhood surrounding it.

The group will meet at The Pershing Square Café at 90 east 42nd across from Grand Central at 11:30am

Following the tour ( approx. 90 minutes )you are welcome to join the group at our Sunday Brunch Football Party at The St. Pat's Tavern.

Meet at The Pershing Square Cafe at 11:30am

What to wear: Dress for the weather but you will only be outside for 15 minutes of the tour.

Can I come alone?  YES!  99% of those attending come on their own.

What to expect: 15-20 fun and friendly people looking to learn a little about the city and meet new people.

Cost: $15 Please bring exact change
results.name: NY Tours For New Yorkers: Grand Central History

group.name: New York Every Night (and Day) Social Events and Adventures

results.description:
IMPROV FOR ACTORS - THE BASICS- Part 1

This Improve with Improv Workshop is the first of two workshops that will focus on learning basic improv techniques which include theater games,movement exercises and scene work designed to help the performer be more spontaneous, focused and aware. The participants will learn skills that help them to break out of their comfort zones and explore new creative territory.


Many actors get “stuck in their heads” and as a result feel paralyzed and/or disconnected when performing. Improv skills give the actor tools that will get them out of their heads and into the scene.


A fun, safe and non-competitive environment is created in which each participant will learn how to work through inhibitions and tap into their imaginations.

Suggested Donation: $15* (most improv classes cost $35-$50 ea. in NYC.)

*Free drink with $15 donation
results.name: Improv for Actors - The Basics - Part 1

This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe, Please bring  $4 in cash.


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP BY MIDNIGHT BEFORE THE GAME!

• RSVPs close by 9:45AM (2 hours before the start time)


• No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense, which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.


Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Brooklyn Soccer Club activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Brooklyn Soccer Club Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Brooklyn Soccer Club or activities.

The BONE adventures tell the story of a young bone boy, Fone Bone, and his two cousins, Phoney Bone and Smiley Bone, who are banned from their homeland of Boneville. results.description:
Photographer & Model Photoshoot Society Presents:

"Model Spotlight: Bikini, Lingerie & Implied Shoot w/Lily Marie - Jan. 3rd"


We're back for our first Meetup of 2016 and we are back with a bang with member favorite, Lily Marie. Lily is a published bikini and lingerie model based out of Boston and has become one of our favorite models to work with over the past year. She gives her all at every shoot and such amazing photos to boot. We are looking forward to this special shoot with Lily Marie as she may be joining a management company soon and we are honored to be one of her last shoots, if not her last shoot as a freelance model. So, If you haven't had the opportunity to work with this beauty, this is a can't miss shoot.

About Model Spotlight shoots:

With this type of shoot there will be one model. (Limited smaller group than our bigger shoots) It could be a traveling model, one of our member favorites or a model with a unique concept. These shoots are designed to be more intricate as far as lighting scheme, concepts and free form. (The freedom to adjust lighting, sets, add props and make the look your own with plenty of time to do so.) We will have a basic starting point for the look but you are encouraged to experiment. (I will be on hand to help where needed.)

About this Shoot:

We have planned out three looks with Lily Marie: First look will be a bikini, pinup look. Second look will be a lingerie look with a Victoria Secret style. (We'll be using the LED lights for this one for a more romantic, dramatic style.) The third look will be a Pre-Valentine's inspired implied look with bedsheets. (As per Lily, up to nude implied.)

RSVP:

For new members: Please take the time to read the info below about how the Meetup is organized and how the shooting parameters are setup so you know what to expect at the shoot. 

NEW: Please take a moment to read the new Deposit info below in the Policy and Disclaimers section. From here on in, we have setup a deposit system to hold a spot for a shoot. This will ensure that we have the minimum amount of RSVP to actually hold the Meetup. So, please only sign up when you are sure of your attendance and ready to make the deposit. Your spot is not held till the deposit is received and I'll send you a confirmation message or confirm your spot on the Meetup page.

Total Cost: $80

Deposit: $20 (Paypal)

(Don't mark the checkbox as that adds the surcharge automatically. If we have to return a deposit for any reason, it will be less than originally deposited.)

Balance due at time of shoot: $60, Cash preferred, Credit Cards/Paypal ok with $5 added for surcharge.

Non-Commercial Release provided onsite or PDF version to email registered upon check-in.

Model: 

Lily Marie: MM#699957 

(Photo Credits: NandoPro)


Policy and Disclaimers:

One-on-One: The model will be available for one half hour one on one shoot after the first two hours in the Meetup. If you want to pre-book time before the shoot, send me a message.

Shared One-on-Ones: We are also implementing a system that has been working for the past few Meetups. It's the sharing of a half hour one on one with a fellow photographer. It can be shared together for the whole half hour or 15 minutes each photographer. 

____________________________________________________________________

About the Studio:

The studios is a beautiful 3,000 sq. ft., climate controlled,  fully functional studio. (Professional in-house lights, props, various seamless backdrops, actual commercial photography sets, kitchen, waiting room, meeting/presentation room, the works!) It's conveniently located to major highways and a 20-30 minute public transportation ride to and from NY.

About The Meetup Format:

We will keep the group small although we have the space to accommodate a big group. This keeps things from feeling rushed and overwhelming. Each photographer will have a set amount of time per look. This will allow you to  shoot as you would in an actual client shoot and not have to worry about the number of shots you are taking. (This proved to be ideal in our previous shoots as far as being able to get "the shot" and enough time to do so. Think of it as a mini one-on-one time with the model.) During the shoot we may opt to give a theme a direction to shoot for. As it would be for an actual client. (Ex: If the setup calls for a "cover shot" then it will give you a direction to aim for and to consider what equipment to use or what mood to capture.) No worries, bring what lens or lenses you have, you'll learn to use what you have for best results. We strive to bring forth real world conditions and parameters so there is a methodology to a setup or theme.

Check-in Procedure and Disclaimers:

Check-in - When you arrive, there will be a quick check-in. This will mostly be so you can read and adhere to the studio/group shoot guidelines and make payment for the shoot before we start. This will also let us send you the release forms in PDF format if we don't have physical copies available.

Releases - We will have one non-commercial release signed by the model through the studio only. (No additional releases will be signed.) If you need a commercial release signed, you can make arrangements with the model directly. Additional compensation for this is between the model and photographer.

Right to Refuse - We have the right to refuse a member's RSVP to the Meetup. It's a small community and models keep detailed info on photographers also. If we feel there is justifiable reason to refuse a RSVP, we will exercise that right.

Signups - Please signup when you know you will attend. If the signup passes the point to book another model and then we get no shows it's not fair to your fellow photographers who would be on a waiting list. It also puts the organizers in a tough spot, financially after booking an additional model to compensate for a bigger group. In case of no show, we will have to remove you from the group. When emergencies come up, followup with an email and we can make exceptions on a case by case basis. 

Deposit - We have implemented a deposit system to insure that the minimum RSVP is met to hold the shoot. (Which varies from shoot to shoot.) This will ensure that the financials are or will be in place for the models beforehand. This deposit will be non-refundable, so make sure you sign up and pay the deposit when you are sure you will be able to attend. Signing up to the Meetup page does not ensure your spot until the deposit is made at the Paypal link provided on each event page. You will receive a confirmation message or a confirmation comment on the Meetup page you are signing up for. Two days before the shoot, if the minimum RSVP has not been met then we will opt to cancel the shoot and refund any deposits already sent. This will give the model some time to book another gig if possible. But as usual, always check the Meetup page up to the date of the shoot for any updates.

Model Cancellation - If a model cancels/no show or a last minute model change occurs, you will have the option to cancel beforehand or not attend the Meetup on the day of, if it happens upon arrival to the Meetup. (Any refunds will be given or credit toward a future Meetup as per your request.)

Waitlist - When you are on a wait list, please be mindful as this is also considered a RSVP of availability. So, if we add another model or someone cancels, your wait list status may upgrade to a "Yes" automatically. Please be on the lookout for updates on the Meetup page as Meetup sometimes takes longer to notify of a status change.

Updates - Updates will be made on this page up to the date of the Meetup or the night before. Emails will also be sent but Meetup emails are not always reliable to be sent to a receiver right away. (I've heard of emails arriving 3 hours later if at all.)

Postponements - Weather considerations will be made the night before a shoot or on the day of and the Meetup page will be updated as well as emails sent if a postponement occurs due to inclement weather or some other emergency. Lack of minimum RSVP to hold the event will also cause postponement of the shoot. The night before we would make the call wether to postpone so be on the look out for our email and Meetup page updates.

Any questions please email me at [masked]
results.name: Model Spotlight: Bikini, Lingerie & Implied Shoot w/Lily Marie - Jan. 3rd

results.description:
Updated December 18th, 2015

WINTER (Dec-Feb)

As the city gets cold we play two times a week. We use Riverside Park with Morningside Park as a backup.

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd & West End) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd & West End)

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

Damien 

[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

[img src="">

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the C local (B on weekdays) to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball/softball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.
results.why: It's fun and you like it...

Hello gang! I was hoping to get this scheduled before the new year - however I have a hunch that Dec. will be tight for many - so aiming to ring in the new year with a good book discussion! We are reading Purity by Jonathan Franzen.
http://www.amazon.com/Purity-A-Novel-Jonathan-Franzen/dp/0374239215

An Amazon Best Book of September 2015: Purity takes many forms in Franzen’s new novel—to begin with, it is the name of the book’s title character. “Pip,” as she is more commonly known, is not fond of her given name, and when we first meet her she is living in a crowded Oakland house under the burden of colossal college debt. Pip soon becomes involved in “The Sunlight Project,” a WikiLeaks-style group that seeks to uncover secrets and expose them on the web. Run by Andreas Wolf, a charismatic man of renown, who grew up in socialist East Germany, the Sunlight Project becomes the jumping-off point of discovery for Pip, as well as a starting line for Franzen to jump back in time and explore the backgrounds of his primary and secondary characters. There is a point in the book where readers may wonder where this is all headed; but the thoughtfulness and polish of Franzen’s prose should reassure that the journey isn’t in vain. It eventually becomes clear that nearly every character is chasing purity in some form—whether pursuing Pip herself or some platonic ideal—and Franzen ties up the ends in a way that is clean and satisfying but will have you thinking about Purity long after you have finished the book. --Chris Schluep
results.name: Discuss our recent read:  Purity by Jonathan Franzen

results.description:
Note: Only RSVP if you are planning to show up.

First Timers, READ details before you RSVP. 

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY

When: We usually climb between 1:00pm and 4:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizer(s) tries their best to be there around 1:00pm. We will pair off around 1.15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY  (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a>

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late or can't find the group leave a message in the Comments section.  Food/drinks apres-climb at John Brown Smokehouse next door (or whichever resto the group decides). Even if you only want to have a beer with us, that is also acceptable :)

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them). This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day. Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC <a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/">http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;)
results.name: Weekend Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
Let's head to Fig and Olive for our second brunch of the year -- on Sunday January 3rd starting at 1pm. I just made a reservation for six - we'll be seated at 1:30, and your $3 will secure your spot.  This place is located in the Vernon Hills Mall on Rt 22 between Eastchester and Scarsdale -- in the Lord & Taylor mall.  We've eaten here before and the food is really really good, as is the bread and olive oil!! :) 

FIG & OLIVE’s signature dishes embody our passion for the best olive oils and cuisine from the Mediterranean region. Each meal begins with a taste of three distinct extra virgin olive oils with the restaurant’s freshly baked Rosemary Olive Oil Fougasse Bread. Guests can gather at the bar and lounge to enjoy tasting dishes and shareable small plates such as the Zucchini Carpaccio and the Fig Gorgonzola Tartlet alongside an assortment of Crostinis, Crudos, Cicchetti & Fritti, imported charcuterie . Main dishes include Riviera Shrimp & Salmon Salad, Octopus a la Gallega, Zucchini Blossom & Goat Cheese Ravioli, Paella del Mar, Mediterranean Branzino, and the FIG & OLIVE Rosemary Lamb Chop. Desserts include Crème Brulee Cheesecake and the Caramelized Apple Tart. The exceptional wine list includes over 30 varietals from the South of France, Italy, and Spain that are offered by the glass, along with full bottles and champagne.


Here's the link to their Brunch menu: http://www.figandolive.com/wp-content/uploads/SD_Brunch.pdf

Here are snippets of reviews about this place: 

from Westchester magazine: The zucchini carpaccio at the new butter-free (olive oil only) Mediterranean restaurant Fig & Olive Westchester (696 White Plains Rd, Scarsdale[masked]) is the perfect starter to any meal: thinly sliced zucchini finished with Picholine olive oil, fresh lemon juice, pine nuts, and Parmesan. Equally delicious is the Provençe vegetable and burrata platter of burrata, tomato, balsamic, arugula, black olive, zucchini, and bell pepper served with pesto ricotta dip and basil olive oil. And the list goes on: fig Gorgonzola tartlet; penne with cremini mushroom, Parmesan, black truffle paste, and white truffle olive oil; and the mushroom and truffle soup.

Another said, "Very surprised how excellent the service and food quality was. I had previously visited and was not impressed but clearly they have improved tremendously ... Will definitely visit again!"


and one more said, "Just as delicious as their West Hollywood location.  My parents were in town and we were too tired to head into the city for dinner but wanted a nice experience.  This location did not disappoint, interesting olive oils offered with the focaccia bread.  We had the burrata and shrimp crostinis which were great, burrata was incredibly creamy and fresh.  I had the penne fungi tartufo, you can't really go wrong with white truffle olive oil.  My husband's veal was perfectly cooked, my dad was pleased with the sirloin and raved about the carrots, but the best presentation went to my mom's rosemary lamb chops.  They are uncovered as they come to the table and a wonderful smokey smell billows out.  You can't really go wrong with any desert option here, the chocolate pot de creme, the warm chocolate souffle and the the green apple sorbet drizzled with olive oil was so refreshing and delicious, great combination. I found the service to be very attentive and polite."

And lastly, "I came here on a Sunday for brunch with my husband. My hubby has a big appetite so we each ordered a dish AND a side.  I ordered the truffled scrambled eggs (served with side salad) and a side of the cured salmon. He ordered the salmon poached eggs with a side of the applewood bacon. The side of salmon was HUGE - it could be a meal in itself! It was extremely fresh, as well and was served with a yummy dill cream. My eggs were delicious and served in a skillet atop a wooden cutting board. I thought the cutting board was cute but impractical as my salad greens kept falling off of it onto the table. :-/


They do have a pre-fixe brunch menu but we opted not to do that because the meals we wanted weren't offered AND we didn't want dessert. The coffee here was great, although not super hot. 

Good meal, beautiful place. We ended up leaving pretty full. AND - if you book on OpenTable you can pay from your phone without waiting to receive the bill from your server. We were happy about that because we were in a bit of a rush.

<a href="http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fig-and-olive-scarsdale?reviewid=rph6eb0n7huiHUXuVmpQnA&select=nAr4LtGY7ouFgZKkpjQUVA"></a> Soooo... see you there! 

<a href="http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fig-and-olive-scarsdale?reviewid=rph6eb0n7huiHUXuVmpQnA&select=EuMdq9QP8NF8pxLiwW-Dfw"></a>

results.description: Let’s have some fun this Sun. closer to home. Walk starts at the S.I. Ferry. Let’s explore lower Manhattan by going North along the Hudson and then turning East on Chambers Street, and then continuing East over the Brooklyn Bridge into Brooklyn where we will walk to the Promenade and Brooklyn Bridge Park if time permits. The walk will be at a brisk, but not running pace with stops at a lot of interesting places. This is not a tour. This fun hike will be 4-5 miles on paved paths. Bring water, and dress for the weather on this urban hike. Sneakers are fine since we are not in the mountains and are walking on concreate and asphalt most of the day. No lunch stop, so eat lunch before you arrive. We will meet @1 PM in Front of the Staten Island Ferry. Walk ends in Brooklyn at the Court Street Borough hall train station where you can get the R, 2, 3, and 4 Trains. Rain Cancels. L: Joe Nigro[masked] (please only call between 7:30 PM and 9:30 PM) [masked].

results.description:
Hi Brights, locals and visitors, out of state and international!

Also, to those who are curious about The Brights (the-brights.net) or who we are allied with. You are welcome to explore natural reality with us too!)


As Always: The Museum of Natural History. Every Month. Same Time. Same place. Until further notice.

(Please Note: To further our efforts at remembrance of those like-minded friends who have past away, we are exploring ideas to entrench and revisit their inspirations by creating a fund to set up benches, plaques, fountains and other things in our city. This will be an ongoing discussion until implemented.)


Our monthly Museum Walk and Talk is perpetually on the first Sunday of every month! Same time at 1pm under the lobby dinosaurs (at or near, in the round). At 1:30 we move to the downstairs cafe to nosh and chat. Then we start exploring at 2:30. I usually have a blue New York Atheists hat on and a small brights buttons.

Generally, we try to keep it cheap and educational. The Museum of Natural History's admission is by donation. several of us are members and therefore we take people in as guests as we can. The museum itself is by donation so it is very accessible to everyone. Never avoid coming if you feel you cannot afford it. Just let me know in confidence.


Other events are planned ad-hoc and the city and tri-state  is our oyster...

RSVPs are appreciated but not required unless specifically stated.

Bright Cheers Evolving (BCE),
Charlie [masked], mobile)
Acting Director of The New York Brights

"In general people are not born stupid. True stupidity
is achieved only through great effort, such as the Creation Museum in Petersburg, KY"

-Giddian, a Brights Leader, is http://itanjo.com/... and Atheist Axioms at Cafe Press
results.why: Our Bright Walk and Talks are explorations of science, culture and reality with informal chat between like-minded, respectful people.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet under the lobby dinos 1-1:30 then we will move to the lower cafe for an hour before exploring. I will have a blue New York Atheist hat on wearing various buttons and pins as well.

results.description:
Join us for a day of volunteering at one of New York's most well noted charities in America. God's Love We Deliver has been an advocate for assistant living to an endless amount of tri-state residents who are HIV or living with AIDS. The organization was started by Ganga Stone, who paid a visited her friend Richard, a man living with AIDS. She realized very quickly how limited the resources were for people with AIDS. This organization now helps a larger community of any person with a severe illness.


During the time of this relationship that would change her life, New York was discovering AIDS and there was often a stigma towards people who lived with the disease. During the 80s & 90s, when you were diagnosed with AIDS or HIV, many people in the medical field and everyday society treated you poorly or avoided contact.

800,000 meals a year!


Ganga Stone wanted to pilot a program that would do for the millions of helpless victims of this disease by preparing food with love. When they were too sick to care for themselves, God's Love We Deliver "GLWD" would provide the need of a healthy and nutritious meal. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AEXfC_9iO3E

Here is what you need to know:


• If you are sick, you have to notify (3) days ahead. Because the majority if the recipients have a low immune system, this is very important.


• No Show(s) for this event. No last minute cancellations


• No heavy jewelry.

• You will be cutting vegetables and food prep


• Must be 18 years or older


• Must have photo ID with you!!!!  

Thank you,


Olisa Fowlin


Group owner, advocate and volunteer
results.name: God's Love We Deliver - Volunteering

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: 

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

"That was absolutely amazing! I don't think I have ever fully let go and quieted my mind like that before. I feel so inspired. By the end of the session I was filled with so much love - love for myself, for others, and love coming from Source. Unconditional, pure love. Thank you." C.L.

"Instead of the 'knowledge gained', I find it appropriate to give a 5 star to 'raising my vibrations' during the meditation.... the energy of the group was Amazing and ZINGING! Thanks... " - S

"Thank you Tracy for a wonderful start to the day. Amazing calmness capturing everyone's energy on the class. Look forward to attending the next on-line class. Thank you." - B.J

"Very enlightening and a positive way for those that can't make it physically to do so remotely.""Thank you, the second section moved me the most. I had a real moment of knowing who I was, am and always be. Also, I have in the past trained in yoga and meditation but not practiced for a number of years - I felt all the beauty of it flowing connecting through my source once again aaaahhh bliss." - A.S.

"Truly inspirational, loved it, thank you ." - Anonymous

"Really loved being able to just switch on and meditate." - L.M.

"So relaxing and cleansing." - T.H.

"Awesome meditation Tracy! One of the most powerful sessions I have ever had. Wow." - G.R.

"I absolutely loved the meditation. The music was one that I truly enjoyed. Thank you so much for this. Many blessings to you." - S.

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****

Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 2:00. We typically start 20-30 minutes after 2:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

Art of Tabla is dedicated to promote, teach and manufacture the Indian Tabla to a world-wide audience. Learn the language, culture, repertoire and intricate techniques of tabla playing.

Whoever said down home Southern food can't be made vegan has not been to this cooking class!

Jenné Claiborne is going to teach you how to make some amazing southern staples without using an ounce of butter, pork, or any other animal product. This Georgia native has been a professional vegan chef for three years, and making southern food vegan has been a joy of hers for even longer.

We won't be using any mock meats in this class. Rather, we'll be relying on whole foods to do the job.

In this class you'll learn how to make: 

- Creamy Mac & "Cheese" 
- Perfect Smokey Collards 
- Spicy "Crab" Cakes 
- Strawberry Shortcakes

results.description:
Deadline for submission of stories to be critiqued is Monday of the week preceeding the Meetup. On Tuesday, an email will be sent, listing the stories to be critiqued and in what order. Print out and mark up your copies in advance or read and mark up electronic comments.

Stories can be any length up to approx. 7,000 words. Flash fiction welcome.

You can submit your story to me (Marcy) directly, or submit to Dropbox per the Procedures (see below). My email is [masked].

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. Read through our Short Story Group Procedures for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.

Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure to make sure critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, so writers leave with a clear idea of what to do next with their stories.

We also spend time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know!

Flash pieces: If there is time (and there usually is), we can critique one or two last minute flash pieces that weren't submitted. Best method is to print out a copy for each participant. We will read the story there and give on-the-spot critiques.
results.name: Marcy's Short Story Meetup

results.description:
Happy New Year! Welcome new meetup group members. 

I'm sorry that we did not see "Assassination" in movie theaters. However, our group is sponsored by CJ Entertainment and designated for CJ movies.


Our first movie for 2016 is the Korean blockbuster, "The Himalayas." 

"The Himalayas" stars Hwang Jung Min (Ode to My Father, Veteran) as Um Hong Gil, an acclaimed mountaineer who embarks to Mt. Everest to retrieve the body of his junior climber. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2nOsV7qgzDs

The action-packed film continues to break records in Korea, with more audiences turning out for the domestic movie than "Star Wars: The Force Awakens." 

For our first meetup of 2016, we will meet at the AMC Empire 25 in New York City on Sunday, January 3 for the 3:50 p.m. screening. Meetup time is 3:15 p.m. to allow time to pick up tickets and meet prior to the film. 

Please note that tickets should be purchased in advance to guarantee seats.

The group will meet up again after the film for coffee and snacks at a nearby restaurant, which will be determined on the basis of weather and location.


Please stay tuned  for future activities, which I will schedule in the upcoming year.

results.description:
Amahl and the Night Visitors is a popular Christmas piece which I've never actually heard! I assume it is about a young boy and the Three Kings, but I could be very wrong. So here's a great opportunity for us either to experience for the first time, or hear it again, at a FREE concert.


ABOUT GRACE CHURCH:

Grace Church started as a sort of mission chapel of Trinity Church to immigrants, but by the time the congregation was ready to build a new church on Broadway near 10 Street in the 1840s, they were distinctly well heeled. In fact, we can still see the names of some of the fashionable families that originally rented the high-priced pews at Grace, because the plates are still attached to those very pews.

How to meet us:

Meet us at 3:30pm just inside the church vestibule. Please be prompt for this one, as we'll want to go inside quickly to be seated before the performance starts at 4pm. I will be holding my hand-scrawled MEETUP sign.

Admission:


No admission fee per se to Grace Church, but there might be a collection or request for free will offering, so be prepared for that, especially since they're giving us a concert. We do also have our own $1 fee to help defray the costs of maintaining this meetup group, payable to the organizer.

results.description:
This is a weekly introductory improv class taught Sundays from 3:30-5:30pm.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

This class is $10.  If money is an issue for you, let me know and we can work something out.  The cost goes to pay for the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  

Hope to see you there!


Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater. He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

Dear friends,

Last Sunday's Chatty Concert at Caffe Vivaldi was truly magical. 

A new Classical for All follower said she feels like she just took a crash course in classical music, she learned so much while enjoying the music and the atmosphere. "You don't feel "left out", which happens sometimes in classical music concerts, you start thinking this isn't something I would understand, but here it was the opposite. I'll bring my friends every Sunday!" 

Join us this week for an amazing time!

"Chatty Pianist" Emir GAMSIZOGLU; www.emirgamsiz.com

Screen legends Charlotte Rampling and Tom Courtenay star in Haigh’s (Weekend, HBO’s Looking) moving and profound look at marriage and the secrets we keep. Kate Mercer is deep in preparations for her 45th wedding anniversary. All is going as planned, until a letter arrives for her husband (Courtenay). The body of his first love, vanished in a hiking accident a half-century earlier, has been discovered, frozen and preserved in the glaciers of the Alps—calling everything Kate thought she knew about her marriage into question.

Winner, Best Actress (Charlotte Rampling), Los Angeles Film Critics Association
